RECORD:
Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Spastic Paraplegia 82, Autosomal Recessive present clinical features that include muscle weakness, spasticity, and hyperreflexia.

This disease is caused by mutations in the SPAG1 gene and is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. The SPAG1 gene provides instructions for making a protein called spectrin alpha chain, which is found in the membranes of. Some special cases also present with ataxia, which is a loss of muscle coordination.
